oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Measuring the accuracy of a knowledge base in conventional and DAI frameworks
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ANANTARAM, C
SARMA, VVS
NAGARAJA, G
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: systems
verification
validation
rule based system
accuracy
knowledge-context
concept analysis
rough sets
dai systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The level of accuracy of a Knowledge Base determines the quality of performance of the KB system in real-world situations. In this paper we examine this issue. We restrict ourselves to Rule Based systems. We examine the mechanism of Concept Analysis with Rough Sets Theory to measure the level of accuracy of rules. We also discuss the use of such measure for DAI systems.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF THE INSTITUTION OF ELECTRONICS AND TELECOMMUNICATION ENGINEERS,42(3)127-130
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 1st National Symposium on Parallel and Distributed AI (PDAI),HYDERABAD, INDIA,JUL 29-30, 1996
